Package org.Main

Class MapTable

java.lang.Object
org.Main.MapTable
public class MapTable
extends java.lang.Object
This class is used for reading the map and saving it to the variables which will be required while playing the game.

    MapTable()

  • Method Details

    • countryList

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> countryList​(java.io.File p_file) throws java.lang.Exception
      This method is used to create the list of all the countries available in that map. This method will first look for the [countries] string inside the map and the will read the map line by line and will append the country's name into the arraylist.
      Parameters:
      p_file - This contains the name of the file to be read.
      Returns:
      Arraylist named l_list containing the names of the all the countries.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - as it is using the countryandborderline method which is basically throwing the exception.

    • continentList

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> continentList​(java.io.File p_file) throws java.lang.Exception
      Method which will read the particular map file and return the list containing all the continents. Firstly it will match for the [continents] string inside the map file and then from the next line onwards, it will read the file line by line and split the string on space. And then selecting up the 0th index will give us the continent name.
      Parameters:
      p_file - is the parameter containing the filename to be read.
      Returns:
      ArrayList containing all the names of the continent.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - The exception thrown by the continentline method needs to be handled.

    • continentandvalue

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> continentandvalue​(java.io.File p_file) throws java.lang.Exception
      Method which will read the certain file and will look only for the [continent] string in the map file. Then it will split the string on space and will select the 0th index as the continent name and 1st index as the Continent control value and will place it in HashMap at their respective position
      Parameters:
      p_file - is the filename which needs to be read in order to fetch these details.
      Returns:
      HashMap of string and Integer whose key will contain the continent name and value will contain the control value of that particular continent.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - continentline is being used which is throwing exception and thus it needs to be handled.

    • countryanditskey

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.String> countryanditskey​(java.io.File p_file) throws java.lang.Exception
      Function which will look specifically for the [countries] string and then from that line onwards, it will split the string on space and will select the 0th index as the country's unique key and the 1st index as the country's name and will place it in HashMap at their respective position.
      Parameters:
      p_file - which contains the file name which has to be read.
      Returns:
      HashMap of Integer as a key and String as a value.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - as countryandborderline is being used which throws exception and it needs to be handled.

    • countryanditscontinent

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> countryanditscontinent​(java.io.File p_file) throws java.lang.Exception
      This method will particularly look for the [countries] string in the map file and then from the continent unique value, continent's name will be mapped using the continentList method.
      Parameters:
      p_file - contains the name of the file that has to be read.
      Returns:
      HashMap which contains the continent's name as the value and the country's name as the key.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - as countryandborderline is being used by this method which throws the exception and it needs to be handled.

    • countryanditsneighbours

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.ArrayList> countryanditsneighbours​(java.io.File p_file) throws java.lang.Exception
      This method will firstly look for the [countries] in the map file and make the hashmap for the countries and its unique value. Then it will precisely look for the [borders] in the map file and make the hashmap for the country and its adjacent/neighbouring countries. It will add the "DNE" as the country name if one enters such neighbours that doesn't exists.
      Parameters:
      p_file - will contains the name of the file to be read.
      Returns:
      a Hashmap of String and ArrayList. Country will be the key of this hashmap and all the neighbouring countries will be available in form of the arraylist.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - is being thrown as if the scanner can't open/find the file.

    • countryanditsuniquecontinent

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> countryanditsuniquecontinent​(java.io.File p_file) throws java.lang.Exception
      This method will look for the countries in the map file and then will look for its continent's unique value and will place it in HashMap at their respective position.
      Parameters:
      p_file - is map file that needs to be read.
      Returns:
      HashMap whose key is Country's name and the value is the Unique value of the continent.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - as this method is using the countryandborderline method that is throwing exception

    • uniqueKeyanditscountry

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> uniqueKeyanditscountry​(java.io.File p_file) throws java.lang.Exception
      This method will look for the country in the map file and then creates a hashmap whose key will be country's name and the value would be the country's Unique key
      Parameters:
      p_file - is the map file which we want to read.
      Returns:
      a HashMap of String and Integer. Key of this hashmap is Country's unique ID and the value is the Country's Unique ID.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - as it is using the countryandborderline method which is throwing the exception

    • CountryAndItsNeighbours

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.util.ArrayList> CountryAndItsNeighbours​(java.io.File p_file) throws java.lang.Exception
      This method will read the file and fetch countries unique id and its neighbours unique id.
      Parameters:
      p_file - This is the parameter which contains the actual .map file from which we fetch relevant data.
      Returns:
      This returns Hashmap whose key contains particular countries unique id. And corresponding value contains the Arraylist of neighbor countries.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - As countryandborderline method throws exception.

    • max

      public java.util.List max​(java.io.File p_file) throws java.lang.Exception
      This function fetches the first country present in each line under borders section in .map file.
      Parameters:
      p_file - This is the actual .map file from where the data is fetched.
      Returns:
      The list which contains the countries unique id.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - As countryandborderline method throws exception.
